intro: [WRONG START] Casia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas casia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. Casia chiapensis typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
